isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - REMOVE - INNER CAB DOOR HANDLE

svcprocinfo.para: There are two reasons for removing the inner cab door handle, the first is to replace a broken inner cab door handle with a new one. The second is to remove the inner cab door handle with the modular door hardware assembly removed and laying on a suitable work surface, to service the modular door hardware assembly or replace the modular door hardware assembly.

If replacing the front cab door inner cab door handle, use the procedure below, Remove Front Cab Door Inner Cab Door Handle to replace Inner Cab Door Handle on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

If removing the front cab door inner cab door handle to service the modular door hardware assembly, use the procedure below, Remove Front Cab Door Inner Cab Door Handle on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

If replacing the rear cab door inner cab door handle, use the procedure below, Remove Rear Cab Door Inner Cab Door Handle to replace Inner Cab Door Handle on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

If removing the rear cab door inner cab door handle to service the modular door hardware assembly, use the procedure below, Remove Rear Cab Door Inner Cab Door Handle on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Door Inner Cab Door Handle to replace Inner Cab Door Handle on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models

step1.para: If vehicle is equipped with electric door window, raise cab door glass all the way to the top of the window opening before disconnecting electric window switch panel during front cab door trim panel removal.
If vehicle is equipped with manual door window, raise cab door glass all the way to the top of the window opening before removing window regulator handle during front cab door trim panel removal.

Remove front cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. If front cab door is equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. If front cab door is equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

Remove front cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to
CAB DOOR INNER DOOR PANEL WATER SHIELD
. For removing front cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Inner Door Panel Water Shield on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 82 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove torx head bolt (Item 1) from inner cab door handle (Item 2), driver side shown.

Slide inner cab door handle (Item 2) to the right enough to pull both retaining tabs (Item 3) out of the modular door hardware assembly (Item 4). Lift inner cab door handle up and over the window regulator assembly and rotate it counterclockwise until the S hook of the inner cab door handle control rod (Item 2, Figure 91) is in line with the lower control rod mounting slot of inner cab door handle, as viewed from backside of modular door hardware assembly.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 91 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Slide inner cab door handle to the right until the S hook of the inner cab door handle control rod (Item 2) is pulled through the lower control rod mounting slot of inner cab door handle.

Once the S hook of the inner cab door handle control rod (Item 2) is pulled through the lower control rod mounting slot of inner cab door handle. Rotate upper control rod mounting hole of inner cab door handle off S hook of the inner cab door handle control rod (Item 5). Discard broken inner cab door handle.
Repeat procedure to remove a broken passenger side front cab door inner cab door handle.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Door Inner Cab Door Handle on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models

step1.para:
Remove front cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. If front cab door is equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. If front cab door is equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

Remove front cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to
CAB DOOR INNER DOOR PANEL WATER SHIELD
. For removing front cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Inner Door Panel Water Shield on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

Remove front cab door modular door hardware assembly, refer to
MODULAR DOOR HARDWARE ASSEMBLY
. For removing front cab door modular door hardware assembly, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Modular Door Hardware Assembly on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

With the front cab door modular door hardware assembly (Item 1, Figure 73) removed and placed on a suitable work surface. Remove front cab door outer cab door handle and front cab door latch as follows.

Remove front cab door outer cab door handle, refer to
OUTER CAB DOOR HANDLE
. For removing front cab door outer cab door handle, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Outer Cab Door Handle on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

Remove front cab door latch, refer to
CAB DOOR LATCH
. For removing front cab door latch, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Latch on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 91 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: With the modular door hardware assembly (Item 1) laying on it's front, remove inner cab door handle control rod (Item 2) with the spring (Item 3) from retaining clip (Item 4), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 91. Inner Cab Door Handle and Control Rods

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. INNER CAB DOOR HANDLE CONTROL ROD
5. INNER CAB DOOR HANDLE CONTROL ROD

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 82 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: With the modular door hardware assembly (Item 4) laying on it's back, remove torx head bolt (Item 1) from inner cab door handle (Item 2), driver side shown.

Slide inner cab door handle (Item 2) to the right enough to pull both retaining tabs (Item 3) out of the modular door hardware assembly (Item 4). Lift inner cab door handle up and over the window regulator assembly and slide it to the right until the inner cab door handle control rods (Items 2 and 5, Figure 91) clear the opening in the modular door hardware assembly, driver side shown. Lay inner cab door handle with inner cab door handle control rods out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 92 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once inner cab door handle (Item 1) is removed from modular door hardware assembly, remove inner cab door handle control rod (Item 2) from inner cab door handle, then remove inner cab door handle control rod (Item 3) with the spring (Item 4) from slotted hole of inner cab door handle, driver side shown. Lay them out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.

figure.caption: Figure 92. Inner Cab Door Handle and Control Rods

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. INNER CAB DOOR HANDLE CONTROL ROD
3. INNER CAB DOOR HANDLE CONTROL ROD

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab door inner cab door handle.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Rear Cab Door Inner Cab Door Handle to replace Inner Cab Door Handle on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models

step1.para: If vehicle is equipped with electric door window, raise cab door glass all the way to the top of the window opening before disconnecting electric window switch panel during front cab door trim panel removal.
If vehicle is equipped with manual door window, raise cab door glass all the way to the top of the window opening before removing window regulator handle during front cab door trim panel removal.

Remove rear cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. If rear cab door is equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. If rear cab door is equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

Remove rear cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to
CAB DOOR INNER DOOR PANEL WATER SHIELD
. For removing rear cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Inner Door Panel Water Shield on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 82 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove torx head bolt (Item 1) from inner cab door handle (Item 2), driver side shown.

Slide inner cab door handle (Item 2) to the right enough to pull both retaining tabs (Item 3) out of the modular door hardware assembly (Item 4). Lift inner cab door handle up and over the window regulator assembly and rotate it counterclockwise until the S hook of the inner cab door handle control rod (Item 2, Figure 91) is in line with the lower control rod mounting slot of inner cab door handle, as viewed from backside of modular door hardware assembly.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 91 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Slide inner cab door handle to the right until the S hook of the inner cab door handle control rod (Item 2) is pulled through the lower control rod mounting slot of inner cab door handle.

Once the S hook of the inner cab door handle control rod (Item 2) is pulled through the lower control rod mounting slot of inner cab door handle. Rotate upper control rod mounting hole of inner cab door handle off S hook of the inner cab door handle control rod (Item 5). Discard broken inner cab door handle.
Repeat procedure to remove a broken passenger side rear cab door inner cab door handle.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Rear Cab Door Inner Cab Door Handle on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models

step1.para:
Remove rear cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. If rear cab door is equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. If rear cab door is equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

Remove rear cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to
CAB DOOR INNER DOOR PANEL WATER SHIELD
. For removing rear cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Inner Door Panel Water Shield on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

Remove rear cab door modular door hardware assembly, refer to
MODULAR DOOR HARDWARE ASSEMBLY
. For removing rear cab door modular door hardware assembly, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Modular Door Hardware Assembly on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.
With the rear cab door modular door hardware assembly (Item 1, Figure 75) removed and placed on a suitable work surface. Remove rear cab door outer cab door handle and rear cab door latch as follows.

Remove rear cab door outer cab door handle, refer to
OUTER CAB DOOR HANDLE
. For removing rear cab door outer cab door handle, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Outer Cab Door Handle on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

Remove rear cab door latch, refer to
CAB DOOR LATCH
. For removing rear cab door latch, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Latch on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models .

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 91 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: With the modular door hardware assembly (Item 1) laying on it's front, remove inner cab door handle control rod (Item 2) with the spring (Item 3) from retaining clip (Item 4), driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 82 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: With the modular door hardware assembly (Item 4) laying on it's back, remove torx head bolt (Item 1) from inner cab door handle (Item 2), driver side shown.

Slide inner cab door handle (Item 2) to the right enough to pull both retaining tabs (Item 3) out of the modular door hardware assembly (Item 4). Lift inner cab door handle up and over the window regulator assembly and slide it to the right until the inner cab door handle control rods (Items 2 and 5, Figure 91) clear the opening in the modular door hardware assembly, driver side shown. Lay inner cab door handle with inner cab door handle control rods out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 92 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once inner cab door handle (Item 1) is removed from modular door hardware assembly, remove inner cab door handle control rod (Item 2) from inner cab door handle, then remove inner cab door handle control rod (Item 3) with the spring (Item 4) from slotted hole of inner cab door handle, driver side shown. Lay them out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side rear cab door inner cab door handle.
